name: Crowne Plaza Orlando Universal

reviews.text: Very nice hotel and the location was central and close to the Interstate. We were here for the Home Builders Convention (110,000 attendees) and traffic was at gridlock near the hotels that were closer to the convention center. We were happy to be out of the mess with easy access to Universal and Orlando. The beds were second only to the Heavenly Beds at Westin. Plenty of free parking even late at night, quiet halls and very soundproof rooms. It is a sure pick if you rent a car and for that matter Orlando is a rental car type of destination. So many things to do and they are all so spred out.
reviews.title: Great for Convention Stay

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel August/September 2005 and would highly recommend it. Staff were friendly and helpful and our room was immaculately clean every day. The pool area is lovely, must be early to get a lounger as in most hotels ! The pool and jacuzzi are open until 11pm during summer which is lovely after a long day on your feet at the theme parks. Bar area is lovely and relaxing. Staff at the sales desk are extremely helpful and arranged some great nights out for us including Medieval Times. It was a fabulous hotel to come back to after a long day and looked a lot better than others on the inside and the outside. This is the best hotel I have stayed at on vaction. Enjoy - you will not be disappointed!!!
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel !!

reviews.text: I surprised my daughter with a trip to Orlando for her 16th birthday the week before Christmas. We've been there before but we spent all of our time at Disney World. This time I wanted her to experience another side of the city and boy, did we ever!
reviews.title: Another side of Orlando

reviews.text: The hotel is near International Drive, which is loaded with shops and eateries. We also had EXTREMELY EASY ACCESS to the highway---which was wonderful for me because I am directionally challenged. The staff was absolutely wonderful. From the time we walked into the lobby, we were greeted with beautiful smiles and helpful staffers.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: And there is absolutely no way you can leave that hotel without having one of the homeade pizzas from the Market Cafe!

reviews.title: Crowne Plaza wouldn't stay again
reviews.text: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza on our honeymoon from the 29th Jan to 8th Feb. The hotel was lovely, the staff freindly, and welcoming. They even upgraded us to an executive suite. Now the negatives, it wasn't the best area if you didn't want to walk anywhere and I have to admit by the 4th day we were seriously getting fed up with there being very little of interest around us. The only useful thing were the free shuttles, they were a god send. The room was nice but we didn't really feel that it was that great, it definatley needed a spruce up. The main problem was buisness people, they were everywhere, don't get me wrong everyone was friendly and it was great for the pool (we were often the only ones there), but it isn't a family hotel and it wasn't great for honeymooners either. Orlando over all was a disapointment and we did say if we came back when we have a family it would be to a Disney hotel.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is one of the best i have ever stayed in. Rooms immacualate and a good size. Swimming pool was great and the pizza shop inside was scrumptious. We had a great time staying at the Crowne Plaza for 3 weeks, staff where very friendly and helpful. Didnt want to return home.

I stayed at the crowne plaza from the 27th december until the 10th of january, the service was excellent,the beds fabulous and the rooms spotless maids came in everyday and cleaned our room to perfection, considering i have two very messy young children she always managed to have the room spotless again for our return and im telling you it was messy she must have lost the will to live every morning she came to our room but undetered she managed to turn it into a palace for us everyday. We spent new year in the hotel bar and it was very festive and everyone was very friendly and the free champage definietly went down well to see in the new year. The pool was heated but the most relaxing place to be after walking miles in the parks had to be the spar (fab)!!
reviews.title: first class!!!
fantastic
reviews.text: The free transport the the parks was spot on we stayed at the holiday inn international drive on our last visit to florida and there is just no comparison we payed less this visit and we could not beleive our luck once we had seen the crowne plaza, it is just the best place we have ever stayed and we will certainly stay there when we return. Watch out for Douglas and Tommy in reception if you have any questions they are the people to ask. I really need to go back soon.

reviews.title: Very Disappointed
reviews.text: I took my grandson as a treat for his 16th to orlando and we stayed for 2 weeks at the hotel and all i can say is that the crowne is fantastic..beds great clean rooms..every thing was great...the air con didnt bother us we slept right through the night with it on and it was great coming back at the end of a tiring day out to the our room..another thing was the breakfast at the hotel was the best ..we actually tried out lots of places and they dont rate at all....thanks crowne plaza you made mine and my grandson's holiday fantastic and we hope to be back in the future

reviews.title: Highly reccommend this hotel
reviews.text: We got a great deal on this hotel through Hotwire, and after reading all the revies on Trip Advisor, deciced to go for it. We were very pleased!!! Great location, just around the corner from I drive and all the touristy stuff you would want to do. Minutes drive to Universal Studios, they do have shuttles, but at odd times, so we drove. Free parking, great pool and hot tub, fun game room and an awesome fitness center that overlooks the pool area. Abundance of pool towels, great chairs around the pool area with pillows and blankets (it did get cool this week), staff was wonderful, two sets of elevators (no waiting), pizza and beer available in the cafe. We didn't eat in the fancier of the restaurants, but it looked like it offered a nice fare. Hotel bar wasn't crowded or pricey. We would definately go back to this place.

This CP has an almost perfect location: near the shops and restaruants of I-Drive, but away from the traffic. Self-parking is free at this property. Frequent Orlando visitors will appreciate the close proximity to the outlets and the Mall at Millenia as well as the seeming lack of a touristy feel to this property. There are no pushy people selling tickets to the theme parks, which is really annoying after several trips to the area. We were able to check-in several hours before the posted check-in time of 4:00p. Our room had the most comfortable bed with an abundance of pillows. This is one of the few hotel beds that didn't feel like a hotel bed. The maid service is excellent. Our room was spotlessly maintained during our stay. There are two sets of elevators, which really aleviates congestion in the elevators. This property is a bit pricey, but some off season deals may be found on the internet.
reviews.title: Good Location, Amenities for Orlando
EXCELLENT HOTEL & EXCELLENT LOCATION
reviews.text: me and my family stayed here for 2 weeks in november we booked through virgin. the hotel was easy to find from the airport. the hotel was lovely and we was met by very helpful bellstaff . at the checkin which took just 5 mins we asked for high floors which we got the 10th with a pool view the rooms were very well furnished the beds were so comfy .the pool was lovely more like a bath and the jacuzzi was just the job after a day at the parks .the bell staff were always happy to help and talk to the children when coming in or going out. the market cafe made lovely fresh pizzas to order .the hotel is in an excellent location with a 5 to 10 min walk to the i drive for a vast range of shops & resturants etc. we have stayed on the i drive many times before and this has been the best hotel and location ever we was at universal in 5 mins and sea world in less than 10. this hotel was nice and quiet. we cant wait to go back there .we would reconmend this hotel to anyone

We have just got back from staying at this hotel for 3 nights in November. The hotel is very modern and clean. The rooms are quite spacious, the beds are to die for, so cosy, and comfy. (You get 6 pillars!) Ideal beds to full into after a day walking round the theme parks. The bathrooms are quite big, nice & modern and well kept. The only complaint I had about our room was that it smelt a bit smokey when it was a Non-Smoking room and the air conditioning was quite noisy when on, but as we didn't spent much time in the room apart from sleeping in it, didn't bother us that much so didn't feel the need to complain.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, very good value
Excellent Hotel - good choice for Universal attractions
reviews.text: Staff were very friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: good hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at the crowne plaza for 7 nights comm 20 march 06 when we arrived the lady on reception said she would upgrade us to a suite for no extra charge, this was a nice gesture after travellling all the way from plymouth UK. The room was very nice it had a large living area, nice clean bathroom and very comfy beds with loads of pillows. The lobby was nice but could have more seating areas and a coffee bar would be handy as in the rozen plaza where i previously stayed. The pool area was nice with plenty of sunloungers and a hottub,the only thing was its not very secluded as its right next to the carpark.
The staff seemed ok but perhaps could of been a little more friendly as most people u come across in orlando are very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The other thing which u need to watch is that it does advertise a market cafe which when we asked where it was were told it has closed down, that made it inconvienient if you just wanted a quick snack,drinks,etc as the shop only sold a small selection of these things, so i would say give the crowne a minus for this as its very misleading.
reviews.title: Wonderful!
Just above average
reviews.text: But all in all a nice hotel and would recommend it to others.

Stayed at this hotel at the end of January after looking at the reviews on tripadvisor. Only five minutes walk to International Drive, free shuttle to Disney and Universal. Cheap to get a taxi back from Universal if you want to go to the bars & restauramts in the evenings. Rooms are excellent with really comfy beds. Quite quiet when we went so often had the pool to ourselves, really good and heated. Had a great stay there and would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: New and clean
Great hotel, good service, well located.
reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel in September 05 with my wife and found it to be excellent. Our only complaint was that the air conditioning was noisy in our room, but I have stayed there before and not suffered this problem. The hotel is well located for the attractions. The hotel staff were excellent, polite and efficient. The rooms were of good size, and the standards of cleanliness and service very high. The beds are very comfortable. The pool is of reasonable size, but often very busy so it can be difficult to find a lounger. The bar area is very relaxing, and the cafe is reasonably priced and good quality. This is my second stay at this hotel and I wouldn't hestitate to recommend it to anyone.
We are just back from Orlando Florida where we stayed at the Crowne Plaza Universal for the mid term break. This is the one on Universal Boulevard - just off International Drive.
reviews.title: An honest opinion of Crowne Plaza Universal and Orlando

reviews.text: We arrived after a very long flight from Ireland which we booked through Tour America (never again) as the flight went from Shannon via Dublin on to Atlanta and then tranferred to Orlando Inernational Airport. It was a nightmare of flights and the waiting around, especially with all the security checks and having to be at the Airport 3 hours ahead of flight time. Of course our travel Agent omitted to tell us that the flight was via Dublin. It was too late to change as we only realised when we got our tickets. This is a tip for all you Irish people thinking of travelling to Orlando. Try and get a direct flight from Shannon to Florida and book your hotel on line.
reviews.title: Stay here - it's perfect.

reviews.text: Anyway coming back to our stay in the hotel. We arrived exausted and I must say Dale Hammell at Reception was more than helpful. He checked us in efficiently and promptly and gave us a lovely room overlooking the pool area. The next person we met was Tommy who has a lovely welcoming smile and will do his best to direct you or answer any queries you might have. We were impressed with the room. I must say the beds and pillows were so comfortable. I even took the name of the manufacturer of these beds!!!. It was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The rooms were cleaned every day and were spotless. It was nice to come back every evening from the Parks and come back to a clean and comfortable room.
reviews.title: Table Turn

reviews.text: The only warning I have to give Irish guests " Do not make any International calls on the phone in room ". You will be shocked - it works out at $8.00 a minute - I advised Reception and they said they would put a note in their booklet. At least if you are aware of charges you have the choice. I would recommend a phone card which you can buy at any store or supermarket for $20.00. They are simple to use and you can make calls to Europe and locally much cheaper. The food in the restaurant was of good quality and tasty. The staff were more than helpful and friendly. The decor was a bit clinical and lacked athmosphere. The bar area lacked athmosphere and was not that inviting, thankfully.
reviews.title: Phantastic Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon for 7 days.
reviews.title: Not for me

reviews.text: Nobody could care less whether we were on our honeymoon or not. We were told by Virgin that we would receive a complimentary room upgrade...the staff said, yes rooms were available but if we wanted one, we would have to pay for this.
reviews.title: Touch of Luxury!!!!
Great stay
reviews.text: I have absolutely no idea why Virgin feature this Hotel as a honeymoon hotel-it's a completely corporate atmosphere and certainly not suitable as a honeymoon hotel in my view. We left property at the hotel (had to rush for a connecting flight) and although we rang the about 16 times to explain that we had left property, and leaving credit card details with various staff for them to fed-ex it to us, we never received our property, although we were asured that they had it and would send it. That was over a year ago.

Poeple were always trying to sell tickets in the foyer for parks. There was some kind of high school graduation ball on one night which meant that the hotel closed the bars at 10.30, which I thought was nice for all the other guests...and there were any number of kids in tuxedos whooping, high fiving or shouting in the main areas at any given time during the evening. So, I wouldn't say the environment was particularly relaxing either. We were told by people passing by and in cars that it was not safe to be walking outside in the area at night-perhaps that applies to all areas, but it is concerning at least as:
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: You have to do some walking to get to any bars/restaurants in the area (at least a mile) We usually got taxis which, by British standards were very nice and cheap.
reviews.title: Excellent hote-l Try it and see!

reviews.text: The hotel was gorgeous, the room emmaculate and nicely furnished through out.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with a great location...

reviews.text: This hotel has anything you would ever need on a holiday from bar to gym and games room for kids etc.
reviews.title: Great Beds, but noisy Air Conditioning
we loved it
reviews.text: The pool and jacuzzi were very clean. Pool was heated but was so hot when we were there did not matter.

reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
reviews.text: Staff very helpful and friendly. Hotel would be good for familes and couples to stay in.

reviews.title: Enjoyed my Stay....
reviews.text: Great location to everywhere you want to visit in Orlando.

reviews.title: Made a Fantastic honeymoon better!!!!!!
reviews.text: We stayed here on our honeymoon, and had a fantastic time in Orlando. The hotel was clean and tidy, service was excellent and staff friendly and helpful, even when we had a dirty sheet on the bed, they changed it immediatly and gave us a free breakfast the nest morning. Concierge was funny and helpful as was the doormen who helped carry heavy shopping bags to the lifts and even into our room.

reviews.title: Nice...but not a Holiday hotel!
reviews.text: Fantastic view over pool, that was also very clean and tidy with complimentary towels.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: we cant speak highyl enough of this hotel and we cant wait to stay here again.

reviews.title: Lovely but not for Family's
reviews.text: We are a family of 5 and stayed for 2 weeks during the Easter Holidays.

The room was ok. Storage for a 2 week family vacation was limited with just three drawers and one small wardrobe. Bathroom was very small and average. The standard of cleanliness was good, our room always looked lovely on our return from the theme parks.
reviews.title: Room a 4 out of 5, But ...

aka: Crowne Plaza Orlando Universal Hotel Orlando
description: When visiting the adventure capital of the world, enjoy the award winning service and experience of Crowne Plaza Orlando Universal. Recently voted the top hotel in guest satisfaction among all Crowne Plaza Hotels & Resorts, this Orlando, hotel is where relaxation meets adventure! The perfect blend of modern luxury and impeccable service with a premier setting soaring 15 stories over world renowned International Drive and offering views of popular local attractions and their fireworks or seasonal light shows. A masterpiece that blends Park Avenue elegance with the chic deco of South Beach. The hotel features complimentary scheduled shuttle service to the Universal Orlando Resort including Islands of Adventure, City Walk and Universal Studios, the Worlds of Discovery theme parks including Sea World of Orlando and water pakr, Aquatica, the Walt Disney World theme parks and Wet n Wild. The hotel is also a stop on the I Ride Trolley, serving Universal Boulevard and the International Drive areas for just dollars a day.
